text: The oath before birth implies a delegation of power to fulfill one's destiny in life.
There appears to be a contradiction between the oath in Niddah and the Mishnah in Avot.
Self-assessment as wicked leads to depression and inhibits joyful divine service.
The benoni is judged by both good and evil inclinations, unlike the tzaddik.
Rabbah's declaration as a benoni sets a high standard for spiritual achievement.
Tzaddikim are rare souls intentionally distributed across generations.
